intro: Lippia gehrtii, commonly known as Mexican mint or wild mint, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, creeping growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are fragrant and often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Lippia gehrtii thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks.
